intro: Chamaebetula, commonly known as the dwarf birch, is a shrub native to the northern regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Betulaceae family, which includes birches, alders, and hazels. The plant typically grows in boreal and subarctic climates, often in rocky or poorly drained soils. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a serrated margin. Chamaebetula produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by winged seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
